bibl.title: Letter from J.W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, March 8, 1915

div1.p: Kerr describes rural sanitation investigations and malaria surveys. He requests Carter's assistance.

div1.head: Letter from J.W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, March 8, 1915
div1.opener:
J.R.S.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
March 8, 1915.
Dear Doctor Carter:-
div1.p:
In accordance with a request from Dr. Fulton,
State Health Officer of Maryland, Anne Arundel County
has been selected as one of the counties where Dr.
Lumsden will carry on rural sanitation investigations
during the coming summer. It is Dr. Fulton's desire,
and the Surgeon-General had previously mentioned it
to him, to make some malaria surveys in certain portions
of the county. I have talked the matter over with
Dr. Lumsden and we thought you might be willing to make
some suggestions as to this phase of the summer's work
in Anne Arundel County. It is probable that one
of the young officers who has worked with von Ezdorf,
or is now with him, can be assigned to this work, but
I would of course be glad if you could spend a few days
in the field with him if it is practicable. I would
like to know particularly when such a study should be
begun in that latitude and its probable extent.
